Mentree

CASE STUDY

I designed a web application UI for an internal social media site for companies to match their employees up with each other as mentors. The idea was to create an application that would take their personalities, skills, and needs and match them up with the appropriate mentor. The only way this application would provide good data for our system if everyone was using it frequently so I decided to gamify the experience.

Quincy Green Farms

CASE STUDY

I worked with Quincy Green Farms through my Usability and User Centered Design course at UW. My team and I were tasked with coming up with a redesign for their website while implementing new features like the contact form for businesses, interest forms for customers, and an interactive map to show store locations. We went through a full design iteration for this project, from research to a final design, here's our final mockup.

Happy News

REACT JS + NEWS API

This is a personal project of mine, I created this website using React JS and News API to retrieve positive news omitting news about the pandemic. I wanted to create this to help people alleviate their news fatigue and look on the bright side of this situation.

Typing Game

JAVASCRIPT PROJECT

This project came from my love for typeracer. I recently found out many of my friends are typing gods and though I’m not half bad, I’m not on their level. So I made a version of my own with a better UI using vanilla Javascript.

The Sun and Mars

REACT PROJECT

A friend of a friend wanted a blog website so I obliged and created a simple but cute UI and logo for them since I resonated with their cause. They wanted to use pastels and have a soft theme but keeping it clean and simple.

About Me

I'm a front-end developer based in Seattle, Washington with experience in designing web and mobile applications. I'm passionate about helping others and making usable interfaces for diverse populations. I love to draw and have a lot of experience in designing graphics.
